content: I completely agree with this. The team at Pixar also believes very strongly that failure is a necessary ingredient for creativity and innovation. Ed Catmull has said, “Mistakes aren’t a necessary evil. They aren’t evil at all. They are an inevitable consequence of doing something new (and, as such, should be seen as valuable; without them, we’d have no originality).” Ed describes Andrew Stanton’s (director of Bug’s Life and Finding Nemo) approach to failure as “He deals with the possibility of failure by addressing it head on, searching for mechanisms that turn pain into progress. To be wrong as fast as you can is to sign up for aggressive, rapid learning. Andrew does this without hesitation.”
